metadata.title: Direct and Inverse Proportion
metadata.subject: Mathematics
metadata.description: Direct proportion, inverse proportion, unitary method, partnership

preAssessment.question: If 10 pens cost ‚Çπ60, what do 13 pens cost?
As the number of workers increases, the time to finish a job _____.
15 workers take 8 hours to build a wall. How many hours will 12 workers take?
In direct proportion, the ratio of corresponding values is _____.
Jhelum and Atharva invest ‚Çπ2100 and ‚Çπ2800. Profit is ‚Çπ3500. What is Jhelum's share?

concepts.title: Direct Proportion
concepts.content: Two quantities are in direct proportion when they increase or decrease together in the same ratio. The ratio of their corresponding values remains constant. Examples: number of pens and their cost, number of students and notebooks given, diameters and divisions of a circle.

examples.text: 15 children get 90 notebooks; 12 get 72; ratio 1:6 constant

keyPoints: Both quantities increase/decrease together
Ratio of corresponding values stays constant
If x‚ÇÅ/y‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇ/y‚ÇÇ, the quantities are in direct proportion
Cross multiplication: x‚ÇÅy‚ÇÇ = x‚ÇÇy‚ÇÅ
The constant ratio is called the constant of proportionality
concepts.funFact: üíß More you fill a bucket, more it weighs ‚Äî this is direct proportion in everyday life!

concepts.title: Solving Direct Proportion Problems
concepts.content: To solve: set up equal ratios and cross-multiply. For example: if 10 pens cost ‚Çπ60, find cost of 13 pens. Set up 10/60 = 13/x ‚Üí 10x = 780 ‚Üí x = ‚Çπ78. Always check: more pens ‚Üí more cost (direct proportion).

examples.text: 9 cows need 13.5 kg feed, 12 cows need ? ‚Üí 18 kg

keyPoints: Set up equal ratios: x‚ÇÅ/y‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇ/y‚ÇÇ
Cross multiply to find the unknown
Always verify: is this direct or inverse proportion?
More work ‚Üí more payment (direct)
More speed ‚Üí less time (inverse, not direct)
concepts.funFact: üõí Shopkeepers use direct proportion every day: if 5 apples cost ‚Çπ50, 8 apples cost ‚Çπ80!

concepts.title: Inverse Proportion
concepts.content: Two quantities are in inverse proportion when one increases as the other decreases, and their product remains constant. Examples: more workers ‚Üí fewer days; higher speed ‚Üí less time. Product of corresponding values is constant: x‚ÇÅy‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇy‚ÇÇ.

examples.text: Sudha: 1 problem/day needs 48 days; 8/day needs 6 days; 12/day needs 4 days
Speed 40 km/h takes 3 hours; speed 60 km/h takes 2 hours

keyPoints: One quantity increases, the other decreases
Product of corresponding values stays constant: x‚ÇÅy‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇy‚ÇÇ
More workers ‚Üí fewer days (inverse)
Higher speed ‚Üí less time (inverse)
The constant product is the key relationship
concepts.funFact: üèóÔ∏è In construction: double the workers, half the time! This inverse proportion saves both time and money.

concepts.title: Solving Inverse Proportion Problems
concepts.content: To solve: use x‚ÇÅy‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇy‚ÇÇ (product is constant). For example: 15 workers take 8 hours. How long will 12 workers take? 15√ó8 = 12√óx ‚Üí 120 = 12x ‚Üí x = 10 hours. Always check if quantities are inverse: more workers ‚Üí less time.

examples.text: 15 workers, 8 hours: 12 workers need? ‚Üí 15√ó8=12√óx ‚Üí x=10 hours
1 student, 80 days: 4 students need? ‚Üí 1√ó80=4√óx ‚Üí x=20 days
6 km/h takes 2 hours; 4 km/h takes? ‚Üí 6√ó2=4√óx ‚Üí x=3 hours

keyPoints: Use x‚ÇÅ √ó y‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇ √ó y‚ÇÇ
Find x‚ÇÇ = x‚ÇÅy‚ÇÅ/y‚ÇÇ
Identify correctly: is it inverse proportion?
More people sharing ‚Üí less each person gets (inverse)
Grain stock: more people ‚Üí fewer days it lasts
concepts.funFact: üåä Floods vs dams: more water entering vs more outlets open ‚Äî inverse proportion governs water management!

concepts.title: Partnership
concepts.content: When two or more people invest together in a business, profits and losses are shared in proportion to their investments. First find the ratio of investments, then divide the profit/loss in that ratio.

examples.text: Chinmaya:Sam = 3:2 investment ‚Üí same ratio for ‚Çπ36,000 profit
Abdul ‚Çπ30, Sejal ‚Çπ70, Soham ‚Çπ50: ratio 3:7:5 ‚Üí share ‚Çπ420 profit

keyPoints: Profit/loss shared in proportion to capital invested
First simplify the ratio of investments
Let shares be 3x, 4x etc., then use total to find x
More investment ‚Üí larger share of profit
Same proportions apply to reinvested amounts
concepts.funFact: üíº The concept of business partnership dates back thousands of years ‚Äî ancient Indian traders used proportion to share profits fairly!

test.question: If 7 kg onions cost ‚Çπ140, how much will 12 kg cost?
5 workers take 12 days to weed a field. How many days would 6 workers take?
5 workers take 12 days. How many workers needed to finish in 4 days?
Number of students and notebooks distributed are in _____.
test.explanation: More students ‚Üí more notebooks (both increase). This is direct proportion.

test.question: Speed of a bus and time taken for same distance are in _____.
test.explanation: More speed ‚Üí less time. Their product (speed√ótime=distance) is constant. Inverse proportion.

test.question: Jhelum invested ‚Çπ2100, Atharva ‚Çπ2800. Total profit is ‚Çπ3500. What is Atharva's share?
Grain stock lasts 30 days for 4000 people. How many days for 6000 people?
Two mobiles cost ‚Çπ16,000. How much for 13 such mobiles?
Suresh and Ramesh invest ‚Çπ64,000 and ‚Çπ80,000. They make 20% profit. What is Suresh's profit?
Mohanrao reads 40 pages/day to finish a book in 10 days. How many pages/day to finish in 8 days?

keyConcepts: Direct proportion: both quantities increase/decrease together; ratio is constant
Inverse proportion: one increases, other decreases; product is constant
Direct proportion: x‚ÇÅ/y‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇ/y‚ÇÇ (cross multiply to solve)
Inverse proportion: x‚ÇÅ √ó y‚ÇÅ = x‚ÇÇ √ó y‚ÇÇ
Partnership: profits/losses shared in proportion to investments
Always identify first: is it direct or inverse proportion?
commonMisconceptions: All proportion problems are direct proportion ‚Äî FALSE, check if product or ratio is constant
More workers = more days ‚Äî FALSE, it's inverse (more workers = fewer days)
Profit is shared equally in partnership ‚Äî FALSE, shared in proportion to investment
Direct proportion means numbers are equal ‚Äî FALSE, their RATIO is constant
realWorldExamples: Petrol and distance: more petrol ‚Üí more distance (direct)
Workers and days: more workers ‚Üí fewer days (inverse)
Speed and time: more speed ‚Üí less time (inverse)
Students and notebooks: more students ‚Üí more notebooks (direct)
Business partnership: profit split by investment ratio
Grain warehouse: more people ‚Üí fewer days the stock lasts (inverse)

formulas.formula: Profit share = (own investment / total investment) √ó total profit

interactiveElement.title: Build the Formula!
interactiveElement.description: Arrange the pieces to form the correct mathematical expression.

data.explanation: In a proportion, the cross products are equal: a √ó d = b √ó c.

longAnswers.question: If 7 kg onions cost ‚Çπ140, how much will 12 kg cost?
longAnswers.modelAnswer:
Answer: Direct proportion: 7/140 = 12/x ‚Üí 7x = 1680 ‚Üí x = ‚Çπ240
This question belongs to the chapter "Direct and Inverse Proportion" in Mathematics.

longAnswers.question: 5 workers take 12 days to weed a field. How many days would 6 workers take?
longAnswers.modelAnswer:
Answer: Inverse proportion: 5√ó12 = 6√óx ‚Üí 60 = 6x ‚Üí x = 10 days

longAnswers.question: 5 workers take 12 days. How many workers needed to finish in 4 days?

longAnswers.question: Jhelum invested ‚Çπ2100, Atharva ‚Çπ2800. Total profit is ‚Çπ3500. What is Atharva's share?
longAnswers.modelAnswer:
Answer: Ratio 2100:2800 = 3:4. Total parts = 7. Atharva's share = 4/7 √ó 3500 = ‚Çπ2000.
This question belongs to the chapter "Direct and Inverse Proportion" in Mathematics.

longAnswers.question: Grain stock lasts 30 days for 4000 people. How many days for 6000 people?
